articles.headline: Racist Comments Cost Conservative Parkland Student a Place at Harvard
articles.snippet: The student, Kyle Kashuv, a recent graduate of Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, had repeatedly used racial slurs in a written chat with classmates when he was 16.
articles.abstract: The student, Kyle Kashuv, a recent graduate of Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, had repeatedly used racial slurs in a written chat with classmates when he was 16.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Of the many student activists who emerged from the tragic shooting last year at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla., Kyle Kashuv stood out as a conservative defender of the Second Amendment, surrounded by classmates who were mobilizing for sweeping new controls on guns.

articles.headline: Trump Careens Toward a Confrontation With Iran
articles.snippet: President Trump promised that North Korea and Iran could be convinced to give up their nuclear weapons programs. He is learning it’s not that easy.
articles.abstract: President Trump promised that North Korea and Iran could be convinced to give up their nuclear weapons programs. He is learning it’s not that easy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After coming to office vowing to solve two very different nuclear crises, President Trump finds himself in a bind familiar to his predecessors: careening toward a confrontation with Iran and stalemated with North Korea.

articles.headline: UNC Children’s Hospital Suspends Most Complex Heart Surgeries
articles.snippet: The death rate among patients with the most serious heart conditions reached nearly 50 percent, newly released data show. State and federal regulators are investigating.
articles.abstract: The death rate among patients with the most serious heart conditions reached nearly 50 percent, newly released data show. State and federal regulators are investigating.
articles.lead_paragraph: North Carolina Children’s Hospital announced it would suspend heart surgeries for the most complex cases, some of which had a mortality rate approaching 50 percent in recent years, pending investigations by state and federal regulators and a group of outside experts.

articles.headline: Businesses Plead to Stop More China Tariffs. They Expect to Be Ignored.
articles.snippet: Companies say more tariffs would hurt businesses and consumers, but many have become resigned to the idea that president will do what he wants.
articles.abstract: Companies say more tariffs would hurt businesses and consumers, but many have become resigned to the idea that president will do what he wants.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Nervous business owners are spending seven days trying to persuade the Trump administration not to impose tariffs on an additional $300 billion worth of Chinese goods. Most are bracing for disappointment.

articles.headline: Facebook Plans Global Financial System Based on Cryptocurrency
articles.snippet: Despite skepticism and concern about Facebook’s reach, the company envisions an alternative financial system based on a new cryptocurrency called Libra.
articles.abstract: Despite skepticism and concern about Facebook’s reach, the company envisions an alternative financial system based on a new cryptocurrency called Libra.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook unveiled an ambitious plan on Tuesday to create an alternative financial system that relies on a cryptocurrency that the company has been secretly working on for more than a year.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Nathaniel Popper

articles.headline: Trump Accuses Europe of Bolstering Its Economy at America’s Expense
articles.snippet: President Trump is increasingly viewing international economic policy through a narrow lens, seeing only how other countries decisions affect the United States.
articles.abstract: President Trump is increasingly viewing international economic policy through a narrow lens, seeing only how other countries decisions affect the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To President Trump, economics has always been a zero-sum game: If another country is winning, the United States must be losing.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Global Economic Growth Is Already Slowing. The U.S. Trade War Is Making It Worse.
articles.snippet: President Trump’s trade war is stirring uncertainty, weighing on manufacturing and disrupting increasingly delicate global economic growth.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s trade war is stirring uncertainty, weighing on manufacturing and disrupting increasingly delicate global economic growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s trade war is chilling business investment, confidence and trade flows across the world, a development that foreign leaders and business executives say is worsening a global economic slowdown that was already underway.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek, Jim Tankersley and Jack Ewing
